description: First attested in 1658, borrowed from Middle French anus or its etymon Latin ānus (“ring, anus”), from Proto-Indo-European *h₁eh₂no- (“ring”). See also anal, annular, annelid.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The lower orifice of the alimentary canal, through which feces and flatus are ejected.
(informal, derogatory) An impolite, unpopular, or unintelligent person.
